summary.long: Titus is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a slave of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ for the faith of the chosen of God and the knowledge of the truth that is according to godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the hope of eternal life which God, who does not lie, promised before eternal ages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but at the proper time has disclosed his message in the proclamation with which I was entrusted according to the command of God our Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith. Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On account of this, I left you behind in Crete, in order that what remains may be set in order and you may appoint elders in every town, as I ordered you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not accused of dissipation or rebellious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is necessary for the overseer to be blameless as God’s steward, not self-willed, not quick-tempered, not addicted to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but hospitable, loving what is good, prudent, just, devout, self-controlled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding fast to the faithful message according to the teaching, in order that he may be able both to exhort with sound instruction and to reprove those who speak against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are many rebellious people, idle talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom it is necessary to silence, whoever are ruining whole families by teaching things which must not be taught for the sake of dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain one of them, one of their own prophets, has said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This testimony is true, for which reason reprove them severely, in order that they may be sound in the faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not paying attention to Jewish myths and commandments of people who turn away from the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the pure all things are pure, but to those who are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure, but both their mind and conscience are defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They profess to know God, but by their deeds they deny him, because they are detestable and disobedient, and unfit for every good deed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, speak the things which are fitting for sound instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Older men are to be temperate, worthy of respect, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, and in endurance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Older women likewise are to be reverent in their behavior, not slanderous, not enslaved to much wine, teaching what is good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that they may encourage the young women to love their husbands and to love their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be self-controlled, pure, busy at home, good, being subject to their own husbands, in order that the word of God may not be slandered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, exhort the young men to be self-controlled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning everything showing yourself to be an example of good deeds, in your teaching demonstrating soundness, dignity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a sound message beyond reproach, in order that an opponent may be put to shame, because he has nothing bad to say concerning us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves must be subject to their own masters in everything, to be well-pleasing, not to talk back,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not stealing, but demonstrating all good faith, in order that they may do credit to the teaching of God our Savior in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: training us in order that, denying impiety and worldly desires, we may live self-controlled and righteously and godly in the present age,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking forward to the blessed hope and the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave himself for us, in order that he might redeem us from all lawlessness and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no one disregard you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remind them to be subject to the rulers and to the authorities, to obey, to be prepared for every good work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to speak evil of no one, to be peaceable, gentle, showing all courtesy to all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we also were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, enslaved to various desires and pleasures, spending our lives in wickedness and envy, despicable, hating one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the kindness and love for mankind of God our Savior appeared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he saved us, not by deeds of righteousness that we have done, but because of his mercy, through the washing of regeneration and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom he poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that, having been justified by his grace, we may become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The saying is trustworthy, and I want you to insist concerning these things, so that those who have believed in God may be careful to engage in good deeds. These things are good and beneficial for people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and contentions and quarrels about the law, for they are useless and fruitless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reject a divisive person after a first and second admonition,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that such a person is perverted and is sinning, being self-condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, make haste to come to me in Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Diligently send on their way Zenas the lawyer and Apollos, so that they may lack nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But also our people must learn to engage in good deeds for necessary needs, so that they will not be unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
